context.description: XPath Expression Builder Use the XPath Expression Builder to visually build an XPath expression. The Data Types Viewer shows a tree view of the message. Expand the tree, navigate to the field for which you want to build an expression, and double click the field. A field is either an element or an attribute that is shown with a preceding @ character in its name. Repeating elements are shown with brackets[]. To select a repeating element, click on it and enter an index value when prompted. Drag and drop can also be used to drag items from the tree view to the XPath expression source viewer. This generates a path to the selected item.
XPath Expression editor Use the XPath Expression editor to visually build an XPath expression. Press Ctrl+Spacebar to see the content help.
